page.title: 15RAILWAYS
page.content: The line from Hereford to Newport was built in 1853. Originally this area was served by stations at St. Devereux and Pontrilas, but these were closed in 1959. Each weekday 13 passenger trains run each way. Some are 3 coach {diesel}multiple units; these usually terminate at Hereford, whilst trains to and from Manchester and Crewe usually consist of six coaches hauled by a diesel locomotive. All trains run through to Cardiff and there is a skeleton service on Sundays. This line is an important{freight corridor}with frequent goods trains running between the North of England and Wales and the West. Occasionally it is also used by {special excursion steam trains.}In 1985 new concrete sleepers were laid and the line reballasted. The line is double track.
